intro: Tulipa gesneriana var. rosea-striata, commonly known as the Striped Crown tulip, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, with a distinctive striped pattern on the outer petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–20 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to naturalize over time.
